title: Hong Kong politician says rival lawmaker married to Brit 'eats foreign sausage'
text:

A Hong Kong politician has been condemned after saying a rival lawmaker, who is married to a British man, "eats foreign sausage".

Junius Ho made the disgusting comment about Claudia Mo as the Legislative Council elected a chairman and deputy chairman for its House Committee.

The pro-Beijing lawmaker's remark was immediately met with outrage in the committee room and he was kicked out of the meeting as it was shown live on an internet feed.

Pro-democracy legislator Ms Mo - a mum-of-two married to British journalist Philip Bowring - later told the council that the comment was “blatantly sexist, racist and it amounts to sexual harassment".

During the meeting, Mr Ho demanded that voting methods were made clear and at one point was challenged by Ms Mo, the news website Coconuts reported.

Mr Ho, 57, replied that she was “used to eating foreign sausage”.

His remark was met with outrage from pro-democracy politicians at the meeting.

Legislative Council member Ray Chan said the comment was “harmful to women” and lawmaker Jeremy Tam asked female pro-Beijing lawmakers to consider whether the comment was offensive.

Mr Ho refused to apologise and was booted out of Wednesday's meeting.

He claimed he was exercising “freedom of expression" and accused other council members of telling him to "eat s***" and calling him "scum".

As security guards escorted him out of the room, pro-democracy lawmakers banged their desks and yelled for Mr Ho to get out.

Pro-democracy legislator Cheng Chung-tai retracted his comment, telling the committee: “I’m not asking (Mr Ho) to eat his own s***."

Colleague Lam Cheuk-ting declined to retract his "scum" comment, saying: “I don’t want to make your work difficult, so I won’t come back to the meeting room."

He then got up and left.

The meet was adjourned for a lunch break a short time later.

Former journalist Ms Mo, 62, later said lawyer Mr Ho’s remarks were “blatantly sexist, racist and it amounts to sexual harassment".

She added: “I just couldn’t believe that in this legislature that we could have somebody who could go that low, and I want to put it on the record that this person is just unfit to stay on as a legislator, and he’s a shame to the legal profession in Hong Kong."

She planned to make a complaint to the Law Society and the Equal Opportunities Commission, it was reported.

Mr Ho has caused controversy during the protests in Hong Kong, claiming foreigners at the demonstrations were "American spies" who wanted to turn the former British colony into "the next Syria".

He has also urged Chinese police to investigate foreigners at protests.
description: Junius Ho made the disgusting comment about Claudia Mo, who is married to British journalist Philip Bowring, at a meeting of Hong Kong's Legislative Council
